resources.string: Your BeSafe information is currently being uploaded.\n\nPlease do not close the app.
An error occurred while uploading your information, please try again.
Join me in stopping the spread of COVID-19! Download BeSafe, an app from Visual Diagnoser. #COVID19 #coronaviruskenya #stayhomesavelives
Help stop the spread of COVID-19!
Join me in stopping the spread of COVID-19! Download BeSafe, an app from Visual Diagnoser. #COVID19 #coronaviruskenya #stayhomesavelives
Keep BeSafe active when you leave home or are in public places.
BeSafe is currently inactive. Make sure it’s active before you leave home and when in public places.
Together we can stop the spread of COVID-19

BeSafe has been developed by Visual Diagnoser to help keep the community safe from the spread of coronavirus.

BeSafe will securely note contact that you have with other users of the app. This will allow you to know if you have been in close contact with someone who has tested positive to the virus and either go to quarantine or be tested.

Together we can help stop the spread and stay healthy.
Please head to aus.gov.au for the latest Coronavirus news

Bluetooth® signals are used to determine when you're near another BeSafe user.

Every instance of close contact between you and other BeSafe users is noted to create close contact information. The information is encrypted and only stored in your phone.

If you test positive to COVID-19 as a BeSafe user, a we will assist with voluntary upload of your close contact information to a highly secure information storage system

We can also contact you if you came in close contact with another BeSafe user who tested positive.
Your consent will always be requested if health tracing is required.

It is important that you read the BeSafe privacy policy before you register for BeSafe.

If you are under 16 years of age, your parent/guardian must also read the privacy policy.

Use of BeSafe is completely voluntary. You can install or delete the application at any time. To register for BeSafe, you will need to enter a name, mobile number, age range and your county.

Information you submit when you register, and information about your use of BeSafe will be collected and stored on a highly secure server.

BeSafe will not collect your location information.

BeSafe will note the time of contact and an anonymous ID code of other BeSafe users you come into contact with.

Other BeSafe users you come into contact with will record an anonymous ID code and the time of contact with your device.

If another user tests positive to COVID-19, they may upload their contact information and we may contact you for tracing purposes.

Your registration details will only be used or disclosed for contact tracing and for the proper and lawful functioning of BeSafe.

See the BeSafe privacy policy for further details about your rights about your information and how it will be handled and shared.
I consent to Visual Diagnoser collecting:
My registration information to allow contact tracing
My contact information from other BeSafe users after they test positive for COVID-19.
You need the consent of your parent/guardian to proceed
I confirm my parent or guardian consents to Visual Diagnoser collecting:
My registration information to allow contact tracing by state and territory health officials.
My contact information from other BeSafe users after they test positive for COVID-19.
We’ll send you a six-digit PIN to verify your mobile number.
Trying to register on behalf of a friend or relative?\n\nThey will need to register using their own device and phone number so that BeSafe can work for them.

BeSafe needs Bluetooth® and notifications enabled to work.

Select ‘Proceed’ to enable:

1. Bluetooth®

2. Location Permissions

3. Battery Optimiser


Android needs Location Permissions for Bluetooth® to work.
Android requires location access to enable Bluetooth® functions for BeSafe. BeSafe cannot work properly without it

1. Keep your phone with you when you leave home.

2. Keep the app running.

3. Keep Bluetooth® on.
Keep push notifications on for BeSafe so we can notify you quickly if the app isn\'t working properly.
BeSafe is active.\nNo further action is required.
BeSafe is not active.\nCheck your permissions.
Thank you for helping stop the spread of COVID-19. Your information has been uploaded.
BeSafe needs permission to access these features.
BeSafe won\'t work without these permissions.
Has a health official asked you to upload your data?
Help stop the spread of COVID-19 and track your symptoms.
You\’re helping stop the spread of COVID-19 by uploading your data daily while in self-isolation.
Let\'s stop the spread of COVID-19.
For more help, see our FAQ.
Invite others to join. Together, we’re stronger.
Head to aus.gov.au for the latest Coronavirus news.
Download the government app for the latest news and advice.
Has a health official contacted you?
Have you tested positive? \nYou can only upload your information if you have tested positive.
Have you tested positive? \nHelp your community by reporting your diagnosis
You can only upload your information if you have tested positive.
Help your community by reporting your diagnosis. Your report will be anonymous and your identity will be protected.
Is a health official asking you to upload your information?

Only if you test positive to COVID-19 will a state or territory health official contact you to assist with voluntary upload of your information.\n\nOnce you press ‘Yes’ you’ll need to provide consent to upload your information.
Only if you test positive to COVID-19 should you contact us to assist with voluntary upload of your information.\n\nOnce you press ‘Yes’ you’ll need to provide consent to upload your information.

Unless you consent, your close contact information will not be uploaded.

If you consent, your close contact information will be uploaded and shared with state or territory health officials for contact tracing purposes.

Read the BeSafe privacy policy for further details.
I consent to upload my information
A state or territory health official will send a PIN to your device via text message. Enter it below to upload your information.
Invalid PIN, please ask the health official to send you another PIN.
Thank you for helping to stop the spread of COVID-19!

You have successfully uploaded your information to the BeSafe highly secure storage system.\n\nState or territory health officials will notify other BeSafe users that have recorded instances of close contact with you. Your identity will remain anonymous to other users.
Please upload your data today to help stop the spread of COVID-19
Thank you! You have helped to stop the spread of COVID-19!
You’ve kept others safe while helping to stop the spread of COVID-19 during self-isolation.

"Are you having difficulty breathing?

"
"Please use the following as a guide?

"
"No / Mild: Easy to breathe, no wheezing, usual activities(such as walking around the house) are not affected.
" "Moderate: Mild wheezing, some chest tightness, beginning to affect activities such as working, sleeping, or playing. Coughing may make you slightly out of breath, but you can catch your breath easily when you stop coughing.
" "Severe: Interruption of usual activities, such as difficulty talking, eating, or walking. Breathing may be hard and fast. You may see bluish coloration in lips or fingertips. You feel persistent pressure in the chest, which might worsen with breathing. You may see ribs while breathing, feel lethargic or confused.
"
No / Mild: Easy to breathe, no wheezing, usual activities(such as walking around the house) are not affected.

Moderate: Mild wheezing, some chest tightness, beginning to affect activities such as working, sleeping, or playing. Coughing may make you slightly out of breath, but you can catch your breath easily when you stop coughing.

"Severe: Interruption of usual activities, such as difficulty talking, eating, or walking. Breathing may be hard and fast. You may see bluish coloration in lips or fingertips. You feel persistent pressure in the chest, which might worsen with breathing. You may see ribs while breathing, feel lethargic or confused."
" \u2022 There is ongoing community spread of the virus in your local area or an area that you traveled to within 14 days of symptom onset"
" \u2022 You are a healthcare worker who has cared for a person with suspected or confirmed diagnosis of COVID-19 within 14 days of symptom onset"
" \u2022 You have been in close contact with a person with confirmed diagnosis of COVID-19"
" \u2022 You have a history of prior heart attack, stroke, or heart failure"
" \u2022 You take long term oral steroids"
" \u2022 You have an autoimmune disease such as lupus or rheumatoid arthritis"
" \u2022 You have a history of cancer"
" \u2022 You have chronic kidney or liver disease"
" \u2022 You are on medications after an organ transplant"
" \u2022 Your doctor has told you that your medications may cause decreased immunity or has told you that you have decreased immunity for reasons not listed above"
" \u2022 You have a history of asthma"
" \u2022 You have a history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease(COPD) or emphysema"
" \u2022 You have a history of chronic bronchitis"
" \u2022 You have a history of interstitial lung disease"
" \u2022 You have a history of a chronic lung disease not listed above"
Please contact the state officials to help stop the spread of corona virus. You have been in close contact with a positive COVID-19 case in the past 2 weeks. You are advised to go to quarantine
